title: the life-changing magic of tidying up
subtitle: marie kondo
description: trying to spark some joy heading into the new decade.

title: sprint
subtitle: jake knapp
quoted: how to solve big problems and test new ideas
description: building and breaking in the span of five days

title: cruel intentions
description: so definitely malicious and cruel; i'd seen enough of this film through clips and cultural references that i'd already seen all of the film without seeing it in its entirety.

title: anne with an e
subtitle: seasons 01 - 03
quoted: i feel i must unburden by heart
description: a radiant, exuberant, absolutely effervescent adaptation of anne of green gables. it's darker and more serious in some respects, grounded in reality and contemporary issues with a vivacious aura of unbridled enthusiasm and hope for the future. anne reminds us to live a little more, to keep our eyes open for the romantical beauty that surrounds us. in that way, we should all aspire to be a little more wide-eyed and spirited. there's a great big world waiting for us to explore.

title: turkey drop
description: apparently they make films about thanksgiving and college relationships now

title: disrupted: my mis-adventure in the startup bubble
subtitle: dan lyons
description: makes you really think about what you're about to get into here.

title: searching
description: the culmination of ten-years of digital-native media in the making. opens up the door for more stories to be told through the lens of human-computer interfaces. the attention to detail, the behaviors that show more than they tell, and the design that says so much more than spoken words.

title: booksmart
description: an ebullient film, a masterpiece of a girl in high school who was booksmart but not lifesmart and had to open her eyes to a little thing called empathy

title: greyson chance
subtitle: portraits @ brighton music hall
quoted: we're moving forward like the seasons
description: it's the time machine where the person you listened to at thirteen is now ten years older, a little wiser and rough around the edges. the music feels different this time around, resonates in a way it never did before.

title: last christmas
quoted: last christmas, i gave you my heart / but the very next day you gave it away / this year, to save me from tears / i'll give it to someone special

title: let it snow
quoted: now we're stuck in the storm / we were born to ignore

title: bleachers
subtitle: don't take the money
quoted: you steal the air out of my lungs, you make me feel it.
description: i was going through something and trying to keep it all together and somehow i found this saving grace in 80's inspired retropop and it all felt okay again.

title: nancy drew
description: veronica mars meets riverdale, we can only hope it's better than the latter.

title: dark phoenix
description: not a fitting end to the once-great x-men series. they should reboot at this point with newer and better characters and plotlines that aren't weighed down by their own melodrama. give me the *school* part of the school for gifted youngsters; the delicate balance of being a normal kid and dealing with the confusing, stressful manifestation of powers that you never asked for. that's the x-men drama we know and love.

title: a river of stars
subtitle: vanessa hua
description: something along the lines of unexpected immigration, newfound motherhood, and the pure raw strength of a woman scorned.

title: lauv
subtitle: how i'm feeling @ house of blues
quoted: i'm so tired of love songs, tired of love
description: this concert was incredible, a near-transcendant experience.

title: brooklyn nine-nine
subtitle: season 06
description: this show is on nbc and better than ever

title: lover
subtitle: taylor swift
description: i love this album. highlights include cornelia street, cruel summer, and daylight.

title: detective pikachu
description: still not sure why they decided to make a live-action mystery pokemon movie, but it works and it's charming; the plot is a little predictable and tracks for the pg rating, but a world with pokemon running around is ultimately better than a world without

title: gone girl
quoted: there's a difference between really loving someone and loving the idea of her.
description: finally got around to watch this intensely psychotic, intoxicating portrait of a broken marriage, a gone girl and lost boy.

title: bad blood
subtitle: john carreyrou
description: a scary alluring tale of ambition gone sour, of what happens when you reach for the stars and forget what the ground looks like; for every innovation we believe will change the world, there's this machinery humming in the background. take a closer listen, and it sounds like an empire without any legs.

title: heard it in a past life
subtitle: maggie rogers
quoted: you and i, there's air in between
description: a folksy take on heartbreak and a past-lives.

title: always be my maybe
subtitle: season 03
description: the romcom we always wanted but didn't realize how badly we needed it

title: spiderman: far from home
description: spiderman, illusions, european adventure, and a romantic comedy.

title: veronica mars
subtitle: season 03
description: revivals are devastating. and we really used to be friends. my heart is a little more than broken

title: stranger things
subtitle: season 03
description: this time around, the kids are older and maybe not that much wiser. they're preteens on the cusp of teenagehood, they hang out at malls and still indulge themselves in the games of their youth.

title: fleabag
subtitle: seasons 01 - 02
description: hilariously punchy, self-destructive, and a little bit lonely. fleabag will deadpan into the camera and remind you that the world is still a little messed up, but at least she can laugh about it.

title: killing eve
subtitle: season 02
description: mysterious, intoxicating, the cat and mouse game that spans months and continents; and even more deadly together.

title: game of thrones
subtitle: season 08
description: this is what saying goodbye to an era is like. there's a lot to process, so many of storylines built over the years and even more characters to let go of. the world wasn't quite ready for this to end, but it did anyway.

title: avengers: endgame
subtitle: april 26, 2019
description: the end of an era. bring tissues, popcorn, all the heart and soul and action of the mcu packed into a three-hour masterpiece.

title: iron man
description: it was a bad idea to watch this right before endgame.

title: the bold type
subtitle: season 03
description: bigger, brighter, bolder

title: superstore
subtitle: season 04
description: turning the drudge of retail into hilarity

title: the resident
subtitle: season 02
description: heart-stopping, blood pumping. the world of medicine is a messy one

title: fresh off the boat
subtitle: season 05
description: by some miracle, this tiny abc sitcom about a chinese-american immigrant family has made it to 100 episodes

title: kim's convenience
subtitle: seasons 01 - 03
description: a wonderful canadian delight about a korean family that runs a neighborhood convenience store.

title: spiderman: into the spiderverse
description: vibrant. every frame is pulled from a comic-book panel. gorgeous art direction, taking animation and comic books where they have never gone before in cinemetography. a gripping, heart-warming story about a kid from brooklyn taking a (rather large) leap of faith.

title: captain marvel
description: it was about time we got a female superhero around here

title: love, simon
description: spinning round and round on a ferris wheel until you find the one you're destined to be with.

title: the darkest minds
quoted: say you'll remember me / standing in a nice dress / staring at the sunset, babe / red lips and rosy cheeks / say you'll see me again / even if it's just in your wildest dreams

title: mamma mia: here we go again
quoted: waterloo. couldn't escape if i wanted to. knowing my fate is to be with you.
description: and here we went again, into the past and forward again.

title: chasing happiness
subtitle: jonas brothers
quoted: you say the word and i'll go anywhere blindly
description: and all of a sudden, it's like watching the past ten years of your life musically unravel, all the pieces from burnin' up to the year 3000, pieced together and then completely redone. this is the soundtrack of peak nostalgia, of a childhood favorite all grown up. an old friend on his guitar rendered a complete rockstar.

title: fantastic beasts: crimes of grindelwald
description: so this is how it begins and ends?

title: the hopefuls
subtitle: jennifer close
description: good old d.c. politics
